title: What is the best book ever for physical chemistry which can get me full in physical chemistry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Don't know what you mean by getting full in physical chemistry. (If you mean by score then you can ignore it. )And you didn't mention level of details you want to go in. Here are my few recommendations. -Physical chemistry by Peter Atkins (detailed enough for undergraduate level and I will highly recommend) -By G W Castellan -By Glasstone One mentioned below I haven't read it but heard good enough reviews. -Physical Chemistry: A molecular approach by McQuarrie There are good set of online video lectures too. You can have a look there.
